stanza.line: Love is too young to know what conscience (a)is(/a)
Yet who knows not conscience is born of (b)love(/b)
Then gentle cheater urge not my (a)amiss(/a)
Lest guilty of my faults thy sweet self (b)prove(/b)
For thou betraying me I do (c)betray(/c)
My nobler part to my gross body's (d)treason(/d)
My soul doth tell my body that he (c)may(/c)
Triumph in love flesh stays no farther (d)reason(/d)
But rising at thy name doth point out (e)thee(/e)
As his triumphant prize proud of this (f)pride(/f)
He is contented thy poor drudge to (e)be(/e)
To stand in thy affairs fall by thy (f)side(/f)
No want of conscience hold it that I (g)call(/g)
Her love for whose dear love I rise and (g)fall(/g)
